body: Hey @nehbit, this bug should have been fixed in the recent updates to example files, please let me know if this works right for you now.

@LouisStAmour glad to hear you're interested in Cocoa patches and data-driven compositions. We don't have anything to announce, but we're expecting to release more and more parts as we finish and build them :smile:

Great to hear it. I just wanted to make sure there was an official issue to track this. A bug came up in the Facebook Community for Origami where the breadcrumbs have disappeared inside a patch. You can still hit the Parent button but it's not as obvious. If it were open source, I'd be in the middle of tracking down that bug for you guys... Then again maybe it's an intended side-effect of Origami?
Specifically: https://m.facebook.com/groups/508155215950032?view=permalink&id=508960962536124&refid=18&_ft_ I'd make a new issue but I'm on mobile...
It seems I still cannot interact with "Tabs" example. The rest looks good, but that particular one doesn't respond when in fullscreen.
As Austin mentioned, we've currently released everything we intend to at the moment, so I'm closing this out.

I cannot reproduce this issue. Tabs.qtz works and can be interacted with in full screen mode on my MacBook Pro running Mavericks. Try downloading the example file again and let us know if there are any other details that might be unique to your environment.
We think we've identified and fixed this with commit 3253d97.
Thanks, this issue appeared when we dequoted the source path. I'll fix it.
Adding 'pwd' works. Thanks for fixing!
(I'll push this later today)
I noticed this too. Only after looking through the project structure and seeing individual patches in one of the folders, did I see the ones, that probably should show up here.
Has this been pushed yet?
Is your main HD an internal one or a network one? How much available HD space do you have? Looks like Apple's code is crashing when trying to check [IFNetworkDiskObject availableSpace].
Origami requires Mac OS X v10.8 or higher.
Origami requires Mac OS X 10.8 or higher.
Is there no chance of open-sourcing it so I can add the compat I desire?
This would break every existing composition that uses Layer patches with a non-zero Y position, right? Not sure we can do this.
Also, keep in mind anchor positioning. Positive Y values make sense when the anchor position is set to "bottom."

Yes, I'm def having the same issue. I only see "Interaction 2" under Origami in Quartz Composer, but I see the rest of the patches in the Finder. Any ideas on a fix?
![origamifinder](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1176160/2232178/7440ecb6-9b18-11e3-9e09-97d674a599c6.png)
Given that Apple's code was crashing when trying to check [IFNetworkDiskObject availableSpace] I'm guessing this was a HD/available space issue. Please let me know if you're still seeing it.
This will be fixed in an upcoming Origami update. Stay tuned.
Thanks for finding this. I have a fix in an upcoming Origami update. Stay tuned.
Seems that this will be fixed with an upcoming update as noted by @drewhamlin in #6

I have the same issue.
I don't know if it's relevant or not but I'm using case insensitive file system.

@tylerhowarth - I ran into the same issue and I created a custom Quartz Composer Viewer preset size so I wouldn't have to resize the Viewer window manually each time.  Under QC → Preferences → Viewer there's a section called "Presets for Viewer Dimensions" where you can set your own width/height presets.

Once the preset is created, you can select it from the popup list in the footer of the QC Viewer window.
@jaythrash Boom! Nice simple fix.

Like Michael, I add 2 (qtz) Patchs on my github to support iPad and Android Tablet (Landscape & Portrait) https://github.com/autreplanete/Origami-Quartz-Composer-Extensions-Pack.

Free to fork and improve ;-) Thought I'd share.

I was able to install this on my personal MacBook. At work, my home directory is on a shared network volume. Could that be the problem? 

And sorry for not getting back to you sooner.....
It is certainly related to the problem if not the problem. It sounds like it may be a bug with Apple's Installer. I'd recommend installing Origami from Github as a workaround.
Sounds like a pretty good idea.
Thought this is a pretty generic use case and can be useful for other people. Please let me know if there is anything else I can do to improve this.
See Brandon's comment here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/origami.community/permalink/551784068253813/?comment_id=551788031586750&offset=0&total_comments=1

I have also noticed it. It seams like the hit area is transformed correct but the UI element is behind.

Steps to reproduce error:
Start drag the circle and stop when the mouse is near the end of the phone screen.
Release mouse button without movement.
Press mouse button without movement, circle gets selected/highlighted and is draggable.
Release mouse button without movement at the end of the phone screen.
Press on the circle, nothing happens.

Edit: It looks like the bug might be in the Render in Image macro.

It looks like the scaling that happens in Origami's Phone.qtz messes with the coordinates provided by the Mouse and the Interaction patches.
It seems like the resizing Quartz' viewer resizes whatever is in Render in Image but doesn't “resize” correctly the coordinate system that Mouse and Interaction are using.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/892164/2661200/f36978c4-c029-11e3-97a9-4c8476a1be19.png)

The bug is not in origami, I have reproduced the error in quartz composer with default macros.

Edit: Here is a workaround http://macoscope.com/blog/science-behind-snapping-scroll-part-i-dragging/
This bug is in Quartz Composer but we're planning on providing a workaround in a future version of Origami.
Hang tight!

Hey @0oneo, we just tried to duplicate this today — we think this problem is solved in the current examples online and in the current version of Origami. Feel free to re-open this if your problem isn't alleviated.

Thanks for your replies.

The macoscope.com workaround works but only when not in full screen mode.
Looking forward to the Origami workaround—how are you going to do it?

Btw, I've put together “Draggable Layer”, a packaged version of the Macoscope workaround.
Perhaps somebody will find it useful
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/369957/static/Draggable%20Layer%20Example%20v1.zip

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/892164/2688424/aa5bbe06-c29c-11e3-9eae-6bf1d9568c8b.png)
iPad is available in Origami 1.2!
We've added an iPad and landscape support to Origami 1.2!
Was this feature already there or you guys have just implemented it? It's working for me and it's amazing!
Looks like we added may have added this with Origami 1.2.

The Macoscope workaround also falls apart (at least with Origami 1.2) if you make the window very tall and skinny.  The magic number of 1.6 loses it's magic when the width of the window affects the height of the Phone patch.  You can create a workaround that handles any viewer size, but you have to hard-code the device image sizes and the magic padding number (200) that's used to do all the calculations, so I'm not sure it's worth it.
See https://github.com/justaddmusic/Image-Scrolling for example. Use , and . to rotate the phone on the y axis causing the tearing on the Touch Point sprites.
Issue resolved with a new update to syphon https://github.com/Syphon/Quartz-Composer/issues/1
It looks like the enter key renames patches. Is that already an acceptable solution?
Oh... It doesn't work for me. Do you use some Kineme plugin?
Ah yes this is a plugin. We will look into adding this functionality in the future.

Thanks!

Can you tell me the name of the plugin?

I'll pass this to @drewhamlin for review, we may have something similar in the pipeline for v1.3. Also, @icanberk if you're interested in making contributions to FBQC, you have to [sign our CLA](https://developers.facebook.com/opensource/cla).

Our CLA follows the industry standard Apache Software Foundation's CLA which is also used by Google, RedHat, Zend, and others.

In Origami 1.3 we added a new patch called Delay that should cover this and other use cases.
Just posting to say that this would be fantastic. It's difficult to ask clients to download QC and not ideal to send .gifs or videos.

If you've installed IDEO's Avocado plugin, the upgrade to Origami 1.3 fails because Avocado installs a version Origami with incorrect permissions. The solution is to run this reinstaller. This deletes the Avocado-installed version of Origami and downloads Origami 1.3: http://origami.facebook.com/download/fix-avocado.zip
Cheers that worked!

Via my terminal I see the following. So I deleted both and everything worked out correctly. I think there might be an issue with the updater (which came up automagically) making a second install.

![quartz_composer_patches_ _bash_ _124x16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/232397/4141156/c4d8b31c-33ab-11e4-90cc-746461838df4.png)

This issue happened to me recently as well on OS X Yosemite when updating Origami from version 1.1 to 1.3. I've also tried to remove Origami folder and Origami.plugin from user's `~/Library/Graphics/Quartz Composer Patches` folder. Launching Quartz again and checking for Origami updates repeatedly performed the update process. This led me to believe that I've actually deleted the update (1.3) rather than the previous incarnation (1.1).

Reinstalling Quartz to the newer version didn't help as well...it still had the Origami icon in the menu bar & it again offered to update to 1.3.

After a little bit of digging I've discovered almost identical system folder `/Library/Graphics/Quartz Composer Pathes`. I believe this is where Origami 1.1 used to install previously. Deleting this folder removed one of the menu icons and only kept the last version (1.3) fixing the issue for me.

If you've installed IDEO's Avocado plugin, the upgrade to Origami 1.3 fails because Avocado installs a version Origami with incorrect permissions. The solution is to run this reinstaller. This deletes the Avocado-installed version of Origami and downloads Origami 1.3: http://origami.facebook.com/download/fix-avocado.zip

Yes please make sure you don't have a copy of Origami inside /Library/Graphics as well as ~/Library/Graphics. I haven't tracked down why Origami may be installed at the root-level (we never intentionally created an installer that installed it there) but I have seen it before.
@drewhamlin That worked, thanks.

I  download the github's zip files to install , unzip, use the command , It's ok,
As follows:

mkdir -p ~/Library/Graphics/Quartz\ Composer\ Patches
ln -s `pwd`/origami/Origami.plugin ~/Library/Graphics/Quartz\ Composer\ Patches
ln -s `pwd`/origami/Origami ~/Library/Graphics/Quartz\ Composer\ Patches

note:  'pwd' is your unzip's path.
：）chinese style english..hehe..

If you've installed IDEO's Avocado plugin, the upgrade to Origami 1.3 fails because Avocado installs a version Origami with incorrect permissions. The solution is to run this reinstaller. This deletes the Avocado-installed version of Origami and downloads Origami 1.3: http://origami.facebook.com/download/fix-avocado.zip
Origami 1.3 isn't compatible with Mac OS X 10.8. We have an update coming out very shortly that will resolve this issue. Please stay tuned.
This is fixed with Origami 1.4.
We've addressed this with a "New Origami File" menu item, available in Origami 1.4.

patches are the only ones that can be exported. Support for the other
patches is supposed to be on its way eventually.

Just fixed this in our internal patch. We'll ship the fix in the next release. You can fix it locally by going into the Phone patch, searching for "Disc Blur" and replacing it with a Gaussian Blur patch.

Hi neezer, I highly recommend the Origami Community (https://www.facebook.com/groups/origami.community/) for questions of this nature in the future.

The Browser Chrome patch simply morphs the viewer window to have the appearance of a browser window. You can read more about this in its Patch Library window description. To draw an image on the screen (and in this case, in the browser window), just use a Layer patch the way you normally would.
I'm guessing that re-hosting that `GraphicsTools_Xcode_6.3.dmg` would be against their terms of use?

That'd be nice, Tim, but we can't redistribute third party software without their explicit written permission.

I followed this video tutorial step by step: [Introduction to Origami Video](https://vimeo.com/120349147)  and then selected Code Export -> iOS but it did not generate any file :( When I downloaded the attached prototype from this link: [Introduction to Origami.zip](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xcmzr6sefn13abf/Introduction%20to%20Origami.zip?dl=0) and tried Code Export it generated the respective viewController, any ideas?
Better late than never ;) Last Value Engine, thanks you
Origami version is 2.1.2

Well, I figured the cause.

The origami files were installed at /Library/Graphics/Quartz Composer Patches/ for unknown reasons.
( I think the files should be installed at ~/Library/Graphics/... )

So I moved the files from /Library to ~/Library and all of weird thing are gone!

My coworker didn't have this issue even though his system is almost similar to mine. (including OS version...)

Please, find the cause of why the installation process copies the files to the wrong path for your users.
I spent quite a valuable time for this issue.

Thanks for submitting this. This was actually intentional. If we reverse this `<li>` and `<a>` ordering it bolds the button text, changing the design. Closing.

Thanks for reporting this.

Could you answer an additional question: did you ever install an older version prior to 2.1.2? Did you ever install Avocado?
Hi, are you still encountering this? We've fixe a few El Capitan issues since it was in beta August.
I think the best solution we have for now is just prefilling with the search query for Graphics Tools. Unfortunately this gets wiped if you need to log in. Apple...

Hi all, as noted on the Code Export docs (and from jwebcat above) we only support a few things in Code Export right now:
- Pop Animation patches
- Transitions connected to Pop animation patches
- The connections between those Transitions and Layers

http://facebook.github.io/origami/documentation/concepts/CodeExport.html

Daemon-Devarshi, hard to answer without seeing your composition. Can you open a new issue if you are still experiencing the issue?
Hi, unfortunately we do not support custom versions in our API for replacing the window chrome. It's possible to do on your own (as we did) but we cannot show you how in this context.

Unfortunately we have no plans to support Interaction masked to a circle. For most prototyping/user testing purposes it doesn't detract from the prototype, so it's a low priority for us/expensive for QC to calculate hit area based on an arbitrary alpha mask.

This is intentional. A timer isn't done until it finishes.

Also super old task. Sorry! Doing some housecleaning

Hey all, this seems super old (sorry, housecleaning) and as noted above it's not quite worth fixing this since our primary concerns are with supporting prototyping with origami Layers rather than QC unit based consumer patches.
Sorry, we have no plans to do backwards compatibility :(

Thanks for the recommendation. We haven't decided to prioritze this (obviously, commenting after more than 1.5 years), but for now I'd recommend using the shortcuts CMD + . and CMD + R — it's one more key press but basically just as fast. Sorry!
I cannot reproduce this 1.5 years later. Please reopen a new issue if you see this still.
Is this an Origami bug? Sounds like a QC issue that full screen just doesnt support the toolbar. Closing.

Updated to 2.1.2 public release — sorry for the delay... 

Unfortunately we cannot share the source code due to its heavy use of private APIs.

Makes sense.
Happy Holidays :)

Do you have experience developing for the platform you exported? The code export is meant to be used in conjunction with a developer who's experienced enough to take the protototype code and convert it depending on the use case. 
In this case you should probably be using a gesture recognizer's drag/move function and calculating the X/y delta and calling the functions from there. I'd consult the Paper Engineering Community (https://www.facebook.com/groups/551597518288687/) on Facebook for proper engineer support - I'm limited in how I can help on this front :)

weird. so this error pops up when the things are installed in the wrong folder. everything should be under `~/Library/Graphics`

can you run these commands in Terminal to help debug:

```
ls /Library/Graphics
ls ~/Library/Graphics
```

gotcha yea. you should move everything in `/Library/Graphics` to `~/Library/Graphics`

I had same problem. After several installation/deinstallation, I'm just deinstall Origami again and remove folders Graphics in folders ~/Library and /Library/. After this I install Origami again. It's working perfectly. :) 
Hope it helps you too.

While viewing on device, iPhone 6:
- Scaling is correct, it doesn't look zoomed in. Visible width and height are 750*432
- At bottom, the keyboard image is overflowing
- If I add a header image, Anchor Point it to top left, then also scaling is correct but image overflows from device.
You need to put all of your content inside the Layer Group connected to the Viewer patch. Watch the first Origami tutorial video for more detail: http://facebook.github.io/origami/tutorials/
Oh, I missed this part, wasn't intuitive. Thanks @bwalkin. :)
I ended up uninstalling and reinstalling both Xcode and Quartz Composer, manually deleting the Origami files in /Library/ and then reinstalling from scratch. And it worked.

It should probably say this instead:

```
Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.
```
